timeline.bodyText:
I don't like that this method now has both return value and side effect (add file to generatedFiles).
I would prefer to remove the side effect from here and move it to infinispanBasedPersistence.
What about make generateModelClassProto a public method that accept a Collection<Class<?>> input + targetDirectory and returns a Collection<GeneratedFile>?
After these two changes we can remove generatedFiles parameter from extractDataClasses.
Wdyt?

replies.bodyText: I've refactored it, let me know wdyt @danielezonca
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText:
Why does generatedFiles contain files that you need to filter out?
In any case, what about add some log information? For example I think it could make sense to log (as debug) the number of generated files before and after the filter
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
Hi @danielezonca, I'll try to summarize a bit:

Before this refactoring all the proto files were stored directly to the FS, while in kogito is the main processor that collects all the files that have to be generated and then write them. Since we have to use the main processor to write the static resources to the right place, we now have to collect all those resources into GeneratedFile envelops.
The current function ProcessClassesMojo.execute first of all generates some java classes and now also some static resources, after some calculations it calls CompilationResult result = JAVA_COMPILER.compile(sources, srcMfs, trgMfs, cl, settings);, but it raises some exceptions given that it expects to get only java classes. That's why we have to filter out all the non-java classes like the persistence files.
